Paragraph: Earlier , NYMEX crude ended daytime trade 78 cents higher at $ 25.58 a barrel , following breakthroughs of key technical levels and reports of tighter supplies .

2. New York City: New York City is mentioned indirectly as the location of the NYMEX exchange. It is a major city in the state of New York and is known as a global financial hub.

Note: While the paragraph does not explicitly mention any other specific locations, it is worth noting that the price of crude oil mentioned in the paragraph ($25.58 a barrel) is often associated with global markets and can be influenced by various locations worldwide.
